3.38.text: So today we're going to be using Screentone

7.68.text: Because in the last video we mentioned Screentone and a lot of people said they didn't know what it was

13.22.text: and we happen to already have a pack

16.72.text: But we haven't used it tons and tons

18.28.text: so there should be enough in here for us to make a picture

21.48.text: A: so basically, it'll come in a little pack like this

25.76.text: you'll probably notice that it's primarily Japanese

29.68.text: because if you don't read any manga or stuff like that

34.06.text: it tends to be how they colour black and white manga pages

37.82.text: S: I wonder if it's cheaper over there, because it is kind of on the pricier side for us

42.14.text: A: I guess it's because its made over there?

48.22.text: It comes in, as you can see, all these different shades

51.82.text: it comes in just about every shade and texture you can imagine haha

54.96.text: S: you can get ones with clouds on it but those tend to be more expensive for some reason

60.12.text: A: say you've just drawn something and you want it to be this tone

65.08.text: you would cut out the shape

66.84.text: S: yeah so we have to use an exacto knife

69.18.text: have you got yours with you?

72.78.text: of course if you do want to try this and you're not very good with knives

75.52.text: S: I am TERRIBLE at cutting these things out

77.76.text: so I might get Adam to help me

79.32.text: if you can see where I've cut this out in the past, you can tell it's like dragged and ripped its way through

85.80.text: whereas the ones that Adam have done

90.00.text: yeah he's a LOT better at it than I am

92.32.text: A: we'll show you what this is too

94.32.text: it kind of looks like a shoe horn

95.78.text: S: First we need to draw a picture!

97.56.text: before we can apply any screentone

99.26.text: A: yes we do! I already have an idea about what to draw too

109.76.text: I'm just putting some really loose shapes in

112.72.text: how come you've squashed yours in all the way down here

115.66.text: if you look at it in context with how much space he has up here haha

121.74.text: S: is it so you can put like a bird on its head

125.42.text: S: Oooh that looks like a face that's going in

127.52.text: A: I don't really like the expression

132.14.text: S: do you pull the same expression as your drawings?

137.94.text: when you find yourself going like D:

140.20.text: S: yeah usually for really extreme ones haha

143.10.text: and I don't realise I'm doing it

145.00.text: it comes in handy if you have a little pocket mirror or something you can keep at your desk

152.48.text: because if you're ever struggling with drawing a reference

154.80.text: if you're ever struggling for an expression, you've got a face so you can do it haha

159.18.text: S: that's one thing we all have in common

162.22.text: I don't even need to do a poll about that because I know you've got one

164.94.text: A: lets do a poll, do you have a face?

166.54.text: S: Haha! There'll be one person that's like noooo??

169.66.text: A: "I'M OFFENDED, I DON'T HAVE A FACE"

173.02.text: S: those eyes look more evil!

174.94.text: A: there's a reason! trust me there's a reason!

177.16.text: S: Bill Cipher has eyes like that

178.96.text: A: Bill Cipher only has one eye

181.80.text: okay I'm going to go back to drawing my dude

184.84.text: S: me too, he's like a happy pineapple man

188.14.text: we've just recently got a few new art supplies

191.26.text: and one of them being my absolute favourite erasers

197.24.text: and the great thing about it is that if we both screw up at the same time

201.12.text: it's so easy to just pull in half

203.00.text: and then we've got one each

204.92.text: or if there's a part you need to erase that's a really fine detail

209.80.text: you can just squish it into shape

212.22.text: or you can squish it into just about any shape really

215.66.text: and if it get dirty then all you have to do is squish it up again and then it sorta cleans itself

221.28.text: eventually they do kinda harden up

223.60.text: they'll still work, just they go a bit like old bubblegum

228.58.text: sometimes if you've got these lying around the house

232.10.text: it can be hard to decipher whether it's a kneaded eraser or bluetac

236.02.text: because they're kind of the same consistency

238.12.text: A: and they're really sticky too!!

239.80.text: S: what if blu-tac actually is a kneaded eraser

242.84.text: A: I'm not going to try rubbing something out with that

246.44.text: S: it's totally like the same consistency

249.52.text: S: I wonder if you could use this to stick things on your wall

254.98.text: S: we're not doing that again, can't you remember in the last house

257.60.text: we ended up leaving little grease patches everywhere

259.66.text: A: oh yeah we had to paint the walls haha!

261.78.text: we should show you guys these too

264.08.text: S: yeah this is Adam's loot

272.10.text: S: yeah they're posca pens with brush nibs

274.26.text: they'll be handy for inking the drawings

276.98.text: and then these ones are like really thin little Posca pens

279.90.text: and they're the thinnest ones that we've ever personally owned

287.44.text: S: they have such a tiny nib on them!

294.66.text: which for Posca pens is tiny

296.26.text: because usually they do really thick nibs

298.44.text: A: I've really been liking these ones

300.84.text: because I've been trying to learn how to ink a bit better

302.82.text: and this has been really helpful

304.78.text: S: plus this is the first time ever that we've owned a white brush pen

307.62.text: whenever I try to record myself I end up recording my wrist

311.48.text: and Adam's like "noope. that's definitely not in shot"

317.70.text: one of the very first doodledate's we did, we tried to use a tripod

323.68.text: and it was slowly going down

327.32.text: so it was like if I was talking to you right now

330.28.text: we'd be like HI ART FRIENDS

332.00.text: S: HAHA yeah and by the time we'd finished it was just like this

335.88.text: and it wasn't even looking at us anymore

337.82.text: I bet we've still got the footage of that somewhere

340.48.text: I don't think I'd ever want to show anyone though because we were so awkward back then

344.48.text: A: oh man, just reminiscing about all the awkward stuff you'll never see

348.82.text: S: haha yeah like when people say how do you get the confidence to talk to the camera

352.38.text: and its because you cut out the bits where you're not being confident

357.00.text: S: you get used to it with time, but when you first start, you will be awkward

360.76.text: and you will cut out 95% of the footage

364.96.text: A: we're still awkward but you know we're getting there

368.64.text: S: I think we're just awkward people though, I don't know if that's necessarily just infront of cameras

373.10.text: A: I don't know what clothes to give this person

375.34.text: S: he won't tell me anything about this drawing but he's really bigging up that he's got something going on

380.70.text: A: it's going to look awful now and they'll be like WE WAITED FOR THIS?

384.80.text: S: I'm surprised you've drawn so many intricate little parts because if we're using screentone it's going to be hard to cut out all the little bits

391.54.text: I'm purposely going for a chunkier design

399.24.text: S: See! He keeps doing this. "You'll see, you'll see"

401.44.text: S: but he won't even tell me what's going on!

404.34.text: S: Me too! What's going on haha!

410.48.text: A: I'm adding the secret bits

411.86.text: S: is that why you're not letting me see?

415.18.text: I guess you can see if you really want to

417.40.text: S: I do really want to see

422.70.text: S: so what's with all the space at the top??

427.22.text: S: is it going to be a flying snake

432.14.text: A: "LOOK AT ALL THAT ROOM, YOU COULD PUT A SNAKE WITH WINGS UP THERE"

436.66.text: S: here's my guy I've been drawin

438.82.text: A: is he going to have a flying drink or something

441.10.text: no he's going to have a flying snake haha

443.34.text: I should really start inking this

447.38.text: S: what do you think you're going to ink yours with

450.04.text: A: I don't know where we put all the stuff

452.62.text: S: they're under your sketchbook you dingus

457.02.text: I'll probably use the fineliner I think

459.44.text: S: I might go with the Pentel ink brush

461.92.text: its been a while since I used it

466.86.text: that was such a cool shot

469.28.text: A: I still need to practice with these quite a bit

473.02.text: A: because if you go on too heavy like me then the lines do come out quite thick

481.02.text: S: one thing you should be cautious with when you're inking with Posca pens, is that because it's paint

487.74.text: it can take a little while to dry

489.78.text: so don't smudge your hand through it while you're drawing

492.68.text: A: he looks really sly, like what's he slyly looking at??

496.44.text: S: I know right! Whenever I draw dudes I always think they come out like they're suspicious of something

501.70.text: even when I draw you! remember in that christmas drinks video

505.78.text: A: it's not as bad as that time when

508.02.text: I mean you guys haven't seen it but you drawn me with a MASSIVE nose

511.28.text: S: HAHAH I always draw Adam with a massive nose!

513.84.text: A: I know it's big, but it's not THAT big

516.26.text: you draw me with a right beak don't you

518.74.text: S: I wish I knew where that picture was, it was incredible

520.94.text: A: I hope its been burnt

522.46.text: S: drawing lil moustaches on guys makes them look so devious

525.76.text: beforehand I wasn't sure whether he was plotting something terrible, but now he's got a moustache so he probably is

531.94.text: A: he's plotting how his next facial hair experiment is going to go

538.48.text: A: HAHA that's what he's doing, he's plotting how to steal a goat

541.54.text: S: to glue to his face haha

543.04.text: A: "i'm gonna give him this martini"

545.44.text: S: you'll know if he's been nearby because there'll be a field full of drunk goats haha

551.06.text: S: ironically I really wanted the drink in his hand to be a cute fruit cocktail thing that isn't alcoholic

558.02.text: A: well he could get the goats drunk on fruit cocktail but it just might take a bit longer

563.50.text: S: OOH so it's a BIG snake

565.10.text: S: can you give him wings

569.22.text: S: but then he could be a big flying snake

570.94.text: but he just chooses not to fly because he's very big and it's a lot of effort

573.78.text: A: he's like "I could fly, but I wont"

577.94.text: S: yeah in other news my pictures had some progression

585.32.text: S: I like how neither of them are looking at each other"

587.64.text: it's like he doesn't realise there's a stupid goat behind him

592.02.text: "YOU FED ME 2 LITRES OF FRUIT PUNCH"

594.06.text: S: that explains why he's so zoned out

596.54.text: the goat's officially inked and he looks TERRIFYING

599.56.text: A: he looks like a swamp goat

601.98.text: S: like the horn going behind the guys arm, actually looks like a party hat

610.20.text: S: normally when there is that much punch there usually is a party

614.52.text: A: wherever there's punch, there's a party goat

617.10.text: S: okay maybe we should actually screentone something

620.14.text: so Adam's volunteered to go first

622.38.text: because he's the best at doing this

626.34.text: its been ages since we've used this

628.26.text: A: I should do it in an area that's easiest to show you

631.70.text: I might do this part of the snakes tail first

635.96.text: S: so the trick is that if you don't push down hard enough, it's not going to cut through properly, so when you try lift the sticker up it'll rip

642.96.text: but if you push down too hard then you'll cut through your actual sketchbook

648.58.text: if you're on the younger side definitely ask a parent to help you do this bit

653.54.text: because even I'm nervous to use it

655.56.text: A: don't be a party goat, get someone to help you

658.00.text: S: "Don't be a party goat?" what's that got to do with anything haha?

660.64.text: A: Have you seen the state of him!?!?

663.58.text: A: don't be like party goat

665.26.text: A: We're not the best at this by any means

667.20.text: S: we've only done it a couple of times

669.36.text: well I only did it once and did a terrible job of it ahha

672.00.text: and here's an old one that Adam's done

674.08.text: and as you can see he'd cut through it

676.52.text: S: he might have cut through his sketchbook when he did that

679.88.text: A: I DID! Through like 3 pages!

681.74.text: and with a bit of luck we should be able to peal it

688.48.text: S: and then you get a custom shaped sticker

694.78.text: I'm sure there's way better ways to do it

698.46.text: but then I just try to eyeball it

700.54.text: to get it into the right place

703.82.text: S: you're looking very cautious there

706.38.text: A: I am! I'm like what am I doinggg

708.04.text: did I cut it out wrong?!

710.50.text: to give you the basic idea

712.22.text: that is what it'll look like

714.06.text: it doesn't look so bad from far away

716.02.text: S: and bring it up closer so we can see the pattern on it

719.12.text: A: it's very very fine so it might be hard to pick up

721.94.text: oh and if you're curious about what this is

724.84.text: S: you use it to get like air bubbles out

728.76.text: A: it's just a bit of plastic

730.60.text: but you could use your hand or a pencil if you wanted to

733.44.text: it just makes sure it goes on nice and smooth

736.00.text: S: in cardmaking there's a similar tool

738.44.text: A: yes there is ! it's basically the same thing

740.74.text: S: because we all know how good at card making I am hahaha

745.80.text: S: Aw I might do his trousers in a polka dot pattern

748.82.text: A: that'd be really cool, yeah!

750.66.text: we've never even used the polka dot one haha

755.88.text: A: just take your time and slowly go over the lines

759.74.text: S: the knifes going in funny shapes that I'm not doing

763.50.text: A: oh my god it's not supposed to make that noise

769.26.text: S: I think I tear through it instead of cut it

771.70.text: I have NO control with an exacto knife

774.06.text: I can only go in very straight lines

776.00.text: A: make sure you make lines at the bottom aswell

778.86.text: you know where his trousers end

780.80.text: have you done lines straight across?

782.94.text: otherwise you'll never be able to get it off haha

785.26.text: A: oh my god that nooooooise

790.02.text: okay so this is where everything usually goes terrible

794.46.text: so far we've got a solid sticker!

796.62.text: A: you should've started at the top but neverrrrmind

799.34.text: S: I'm learning on the job here

810.32.text: that doesn't look too bad at all now they're on!

812.68.text: look at that! you were way too hard on yourself!

819.00.text: S: okay! this is the easy bit haha

825.50.text: A: this is the hardest bit going around his eyes

828.46.text: I don't think I planned this very well..

832.40.text: also we got a lot of questions from people asking what screentone was

838.20.text: if you have used it before then let us know!

842.12.text: S: haha odds are you've done a better job

844.76.text: we'd be interested to see how you've done it

852.62.text: a few people have spoken to me in the comments that they had screentone

857.26.text: but because of the price of it (it's about £10GBP for 3 sheets)

861.28.text: it's quite a bit and that's why we don't use it very often

864.62.text: but it's a shame to have an art supply that you're not using

868.42.text: so you might aswell use it!

870.68.text: I totally used to be the type of person that would buy traditional art supplies and then would be too scared to use them

878.94.text: S: but once you get over that initial fear

881.24.text: and you realise that everything you make doesn't have to be a masterpiece

884.74.text: just have fun using them and it'll be fine

888.42.text: A: I bought you an adventure time sketchbook

893.12.text: and you were so scared to use it

895.12.text: S: only because it was a special gift from you!

897.32.text: but now I put any kind of junk in it hahah

907.52.text: lets line it up with your pretty snakey face

912.46.text: aughh I think I might have moved it

915.02.text: if you accidentally move it while you're cutting it then you're gonna have bigggg spaces

920.94.text: S: I might do his hair in the same colour as the goat

924.92.text: A: AWW they'll be like brothers

927.00.text: S: HAHA I've just realised I've started to cut this right in the middle of the paper

933.94.text: with a pen I can follow these shapes so easily

938.30.text: S: with a knife it just wants me to go in one direction

943.56.text: do you see what I did there

945.06.text: he's missing a triangle out of his hair, where has that gone?!

952.96.text: A: this has gone from I'm enjoying this to I'M SO STRESSED

959.84.text: S: I need to get this downnn

962.94.text: A: wow you've done an awesome job with that one

965.98.text: S: he's got a bit of a dodgy hairline but y'know, humans aren't perfect

970.08.text: A: I want to wear pants like this

977.18.text: screentone's definitely one of those things where you see other people do it and you think ah that's easy

982.68.text: but then you try it yourself and you're like NOPE

985.74.text: like carving pumpkins!! omg I saw so many people do that on youtube

989.62.text: and thought that looks like a cute, fun activity

994.16.text: A: I was finding pumpkin seeds for ages after we did that one

1006.44.text: S: oh wow you're already pealing something

1011.02.text: S: ey you're covering up the good stuff

1018.70.text: it's kinda hard to see because it's such a detailed busy pattern

1022.94.text: it makes it hard to see where to go

1025.34.text: S: when I was doing the hair out of that one, I couldn't see where I'd already cut

1029.80.text: and because we've only got one of those exacto knives

1032.72.text: it means that only one of us can do it at a time

1035.60.text: so we very much have to take it in turns

1041.06.text: I literally just turn on the camera whenever Adam looks like he's struggling

1049.68.text: S: because you're at such an awkward angle, I keep getting loads of shots where I'm really zoomed in on your forehead

1059.92.text: there we go, we're getting it!

1063.74.text: how can I record you sucking at screentone in as many angles as possible??

1069.84.text: S: incase anyone wonders where we got this screentone from

1073.76.text: we bought it from a UK online store called Dinkybox

1076.38.text: A: because they're based in the UK, if you're in the US or elsewhere there might be cheaper options

1082.86.text: this was the cheapest for us

1086.00.text: S: we literally got these sheets about 2 years ago

1089.80.text: I wonder what this one had previously been used for

1092.88.text: have you seen all the little circles?

1104.36.text: A: it's quite dark, I could've been doing meatballs

1110.22.text: I've cut this out and I don't even recognise the shapes I've done

1113.70.text: oooh I see, that's for the boot

1121.04.text: I think I got kinda lucky with that one

1124.76.text: S: the moment everyones been waiting for, goat tone

1128.60.text: can I push this along like this?

1130.68.text: A: it might be because we've had it for so long?

1134.48.text: S: I think its because its probably got bent

1138.22.text: oh no it's kind of pushing it away for good

1141.54.text: A: yeah you tame that screentone!

1148.40.text: I'm glad you're using it in the corner

1150.88.text: "I'll screentone it in the middle" *silly voice*

1152.66.text: S: I'm making a conscious effort to do that right now

1157.40.text: THERE YOU GO, YOU'VE DONE IT

1159.32.text: S: I think I've lost some aprts of him but I'll get them back

1161.74.text: it's hard trying to line it up

1163.44.text: A: OH WOW YOU'VE JUST DONE IT PERFECTLY

1165.62.text: it's hard to line it up she says when she does it perfectly

1185.18.text: he looks like he's been through enough as it is haha!

1188.56.text: what was I thinking there, that doesn't fit in there at all

1194.08.text: S: EY don't throw it on the bed!

1196.12.text: we have to sleep in this haha!

1198.04.text: it's funny how quiet we go when we use an exacto knife

1201.16.text: A: haha yeah because the exacto knife will claim some limbs

1204.82.text: you'd just be chatting away when you accidentally slice your arm off AGHH

1209.56.text: that's the same tone as the snake?!

1211.88.text: S: HAHA yeah it's like the snake's gone through her body

1215.68.text: A: I have used a different one though!

1220.26.text: S: I think the goat looks terrifying in this texture

1223.16.text: there's such a thing that's called uncanny valley

1226.42.text: which is when you mix something stylised with something a bit too realistic

1231.80.text: and I feel like the pattern on this is a bit too realistic

1237.78.text: it's just so weird seeing something this cartoony with such a fuzzy texture

1241.90.text: A: I just need to do his lil tongue so it doesn't get lost

1250.90.text: and we'll do some patterned bits so he isn't a completely plain snake

1255.46.text: I'm not sure if this will dry properly?

1257.72.text: S: I imagine it will because Posca's

1262.80.text: S: they're advertised so you can draw on like ceramics & windows

1269.10.text: if you're new here feel free to subscribe!

1271.90.text: because we put out new videos every Sunday

1273.94.text: A: and thanks to all you guys that keep coming back to watch our videos and we alllll appreciate you

1281.42.text: you one new whoever you are haha

1283.88.text: A: Steph, me and the goat

1290.96.text: A: that's a bit late haha

1293.98.text: A: you'll have to let us know if you want a sticker of party goat, FAME will go to his head
